title: Training Specialist
description:
**Secure our Nation, Ignite your Future**


Become an integral part of a diverse team while working at an Industry Leading Organization, where our employees come first. At ManTech International Corporation, you’ll help protect our national security while working on innovative projects that offer opportunities for advancement.

  

Currently, ManTech is seeking dedicated Training Specialist with a desire to assist in development and establish course content and objectives without being leashed to strict Instructional Systems Designer (ISD constrains). Full range of instructional methods are employed in training government personnel, i.e. classroom, synchronous online learning, as well as the use of videos and Articulate web software.

**Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:**

* Define end-user responsibilities to develop scenario-based training programs and lesson plans
* Work with project stakeholders to validate the course outlines to ensure that quality and accuracy meet client expectations
* Participate in the development, testing, maintenance, and delivery of training programs and related materials in support of customer products
* Design training materials including job aids, user guides, quick reference guides, and simulations
* Formulate training methods based on client needs and effectiveness e.g. individual training, group instruction, meetings, and workshops
* Build and maintain course documentation on a continuous basis to ensure timeliness and relevance
* Conduct training sessions independently
* Develop criteria for evaluating the effectiveness of training
* Establishes course content and objectives
* Develops, tests, maintains and delivers training programs and related materials in support of customer products
* Conducts training sessions and develops criteria for evaluating the effectiveness of training
* Updates course documentation on a continuous basis to ensure timeliness and relevance

**Basic Qualifications:**

* 2+ years of experience
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Comfortable presenting in front large audiences both in person and virtually
* Proficient in Microsoft Office programs, namely Word, PowerPoint, and conducing virtual meetings in Teams
* Proficient in learning new software systems and being a
* Ability to train others.
* Familiarity with industry best practices and standards

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Knowledge and experience of Federal Government Financial Management Systems Training
* Familiarity with Articulate software a plus, but not required.

**Security Clearance Requirement:**

* US citizen with the ability to obtain a Secret clearance

**Physical Requirements:**

* Must be able to remain in a stationary position 50%
* Constantly operates a computer and other office productivity machinery, such as a calculator, copy machine and computer printer
* The person in this position frequently communicates with co-workers, management and customers, which may involve delivering presentations. Must be able to exchange accurate information in these situations


The projected compensation range for this position is $60,500-$100,800. There are differentiating factors that can impact a final salary/hourly rate, including, but not limited to, Contract Wage Determination, relevant work experience, skills and competencies that align to the specified role, geographic location (For Remote Opportunities), education and certifications as well as Federal Government Contract Labor categories. In addition, ManTech invests in it’s employees beyond just compensation. ManTech’s benefits offerings include, dependent upon position, Health Insurance, Life Insurance, Paid Time Off, Holiday Pay, Short Term and Long Term Disability, Retirement and Savings, Learning and Development opportunities, wellness programs as well as other optional benefit elections.
For all positions requiring access to technology/software source code that is subject to export control laws, employment with the company is contingent on either verifying U.S.-person status or obtaining any necessary license. The applicant will be required to answer certain questions for export control purposes, and that information will be reviewed by compliance personnel to ensure compliance with federal law. ManTech may choose not to apply for a license for such individuals whose access to export-controlled technology or software source code may require authorization and may decline to proceed with an applicant on that basis alone.


ManTech International Corporation, as well as its subsidiaries proactively fulfills its role as an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, national origin, marital status, physical or mental disability, status as a Disabled Veteran, Recently Separated Veteran, Active Duty Wartime or Campaign Badge Veteran, Armed Forces Services Medal, or any other characteristic protected by law.


If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a position with ManTech through its online applicant system, please contact ManTech's Corporate EEO Department at (703) 218-6000. ManTech is an affirmative action/equal opportunity employer - minorities, females, disabled and protected veterans are urged to apply. ManTech's utilization of any external recruitment or job placement agency is predicated upon its full compliance with our equal opportunity/affirmative action policies. ManTech does not accept resumes from unsolicited recruiting firms. We pay no fees for unsolicited services.

title: Technical Trainer
description:
**ENGEL Machinery North America** **has job opportunities available for Injection Molding Machine** **Technical Trainers** **located in multiple regions throughout the United States. Reporting to the Director Customer Service Division (CSD), this position while demonstrating the highest level of customer service, provides training to both internal and external ENGEL customers on the optimal use and operation of ENGEL machinery.**


**ENGEL embodies a spirit of innovation, built on decades of experience. With a dynamic workplace, ENGEL is the injection molding industry leader in technological advancements, ensuring sustainable global growth. The ENGEL company history is a success story that we keep on writing everyday together with our employees.**


**Do you have what it takes to spur game-changing innovation, generate creative solutions and add world-class value to our customers? Then get ready to join the ENGEL team and become part of the next chapter in our history as we continue to grow the business in North America!**


**ENGEL Machinery, Inc.** has a job opportunity available for **Technical Trainer**.


**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**


* Provide training to ENGEL customers on the optimal use and operation of ENGEL machinery.
* Train customers on technical information relating to ENGEL machinery, including plastics processing, hydraulics, pneumatics, electrical, electronics, safety, mechanical, machine controller, hardware, software, automation, and quality.
* Ensure customers are trained thoroughly on the operation and maintenance of the various types of ENGEL molding machines and automation products.
* Use a variety of mediums to train, including visual aids, computer presentations, projector, overheads, charts, manuals, presentations, and demonstrations.
* Identify machines and process types in order to deliver the most effective training.
* Secure the necessary electrical, hydraulic prints to support training needs. Study such in order to be prepared to deliver training.
* Liaise with customers to discern specific training needs.
* Though training may be conducted at the ENGEL facility, traveling to customer facilities or to ENGEL training sites to provide training is required.
* Liaise with other ENGEL departments (e.g., engineering) to obtain specifics on customer’s machines and/or automation products.
* Develop customized approaches to training based on customer needs.
* Develop new training materials and methods as needed.
* Perform other duties or special projects as required or as assigned by a supervisor.
* Remote work opportunity. Requires 90% domestic/international travel.


**QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS**


**Minimum Education and Experience:**


* High school diploma and 3 years of trade school (or foreign equivalent), plus 5 years of experience with injection molding and plastics processing, experience in the job offered, or in a related occupation. In the alternative, will accept 7 years of experience with injection molding and plastics processing, experience in the job offered, or in a related occupation. Any suitable combination of education, training, or experience is acceptable.


**Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:**


Requires 5 years of experience with:


* Injection molding and plastics processing;
* Pneumatic, hydraulic, mechanical, and electrical/electronic circuitry;
* Ability to read and interpret drawings and complex mechanical and operational specifications;
* ENGEL machines and robots; and
* ANSI safety standards.


Remote work opportunity. Requires 90% domestic/international travel.


Remote work opportunity. Requires 90% domestic/international travel. Employment and background checks required.


Email resume to Jobs.US@engelglobal.com and reference job code TT1151.


**WHY ENGEL?**  

The **ENGEL** group has been thriving for decades. This is because as a **family-run** company, we rely on **long-standing relationships** and aim to live up to our own exacting standards of **expertise and experience** in all fields of **plastics processing**. We see ourselves as a driving, innovative force that has **continually set new standards** in a dynamic and diverse industry. Our **competitive edge** has come from **generating added value for customers worldwide.**


**ENGEL** attaches great importance to flexibility, innovation and self-responsibility of all of its employees and business units. This is the only way to consistently supply and guarantee results of the highest global standards.  

  

**ENGEL** offers a competitive total compensation package to eligible employees, including: health, dental, LTD and life insurance, 401k with match, contribution to HSA, Dependent and Health FSA, vacation pay and holiday pay.  

  

We are looking forward to receiving your application and resume and going over the position with you.


**ENGEL** is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, protective veteran status or any other category protected by state or local laws.

title: Junior ISD Training Analyst
description:
**Secure our Nation, Ignite your Future**


Become an integral part of a diverse team while working at an Industry Leading Organization, where our employees come first. At ManTech International Corporation, you’ll help protect our national security while working on innovative projects that offer opportunities for advancement.


Currently, we are seeking a motivated, career and team-oriented **Junior Instructional Designer** for the data solutions training team in support of the U.S. Department of Homeland Security (DHS) Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) Continuous Diagnostic & Mitigation (CDM) Data Services Program. The CDM Data Services Program is a critical component of CISA’s national effort to ensure the defense and resilience of cyberspace. As a Junior Instructional Designer, you will play a crucial role in supporting the development of engaging and effective learning materials. This is an exciting opportunity for an entry-level professional with a passion for education, instructional design, and a willingness to learn and grow within a collaborative environment. This is a remote position where the candidate can work from any location within the United States provided, they are able to work on an eastern time zone schedule.


The CDM Data Services Program mission is to provide a standardized platform to collect, transform, and integrate cybersecurity data from relevant authoritative data sources into a coherent data, delivering actionable information into Agency and Federal Dashboards to identify risk areas in support of mitigation as well as to facilitate coordinated agency and national response to cyber-threats.


The **Dashboard Solution Training Team** is responsible for developing, implementing, and evaluating courses and learning tools that educate and inform end users, agencies and key stakeholders on the successful utilization of the CDM Dashboard. Successful execution of this training program requires strong knowledge of adult learning methodologies, training implementation and facilitation best practices, expert knowledge of common cybersecurity threats, strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate cross-functionally with internal and external partners. This team is expected to work closely with and develop strong working relationships with government and agency specific stakeholders.

**Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:**

* Content Development:


Collaborate with senior instructional designers, systems engineers, and subject matter experts to assist in the development of instructional materials, including e-learning modules, training manuals, and multimedia content.


Contribute to the creation of engaging and learner-centric content that aligns with project goals and learning objectives.

* Media Production:


Assist in the design and production of multimedia elements, such as graphics, images, animations, and interactive simulations and exercises, to enhance the overall learning experience.


Learn and apply basic graphic design principles to support the visual appeal of instructional materials.

* Learning Management System (LMS) Support:


Assist in the integration of instructional content into the learning management system.


Learn to navigate and utilize relevant e-learning authoring tools and technology platforms.

* Quality Assurance:


Participate in quality assurance reviews to ensure instructional materials meet established standards and align with instructional design best practices.


Implement feedback received from senior designers to enhance content quality.

* Professional Development:


Stay informed about industry trends, instructional design methodologies, and emerging technologies through ongoing learning and professional development opportunities.

**Basic Qualifications:**

* A bachelor’s degree in Instructional Design, Education, Multimedia Design, or a related field.
* A minimum of (1) one year of experience in Instructional Systems Design, Adult learning development, government consulting, or a related field
* Basic understanding of instructional design principles and e-learning concepts.
* Familiarity with graphic design software and multimedia tools (e.g., Adobe Creative Suite).
* Strong organizational and time management skills.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work collaboratively within a team.
* Comfortable working with technology and a willingness to learn new tools and platforms.
* Demonstrated creativity and a willingness to contribute innovative ideas to enhance instructional content.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Basic understanding of learning management systems (LMS)

**Clearance Requirements**

* Must be a U.S. citizen (non-dual citizenship)
* Ability to obtain and maintain DHS suitability

**Physical Requirements**

* Must be able to be in a stationary position more than 50% of the time
* Must be able to communicate, converse, and exchange information with peers and senior personnel
* Constantly operates a computer and other office productivity machinery, such as a computer
* The person in this position frequently communicates with co-workers, management, and customers, which may involve delivering presentations. Must be able to exchange accurate information in these situations
* The person in this position needs to occasionally move about inside the office to access file cabinets, office machinery, etc.


For all positions requiring access to technology/software source code that is subject to export control laws, employment with the company is contingent on either verifying U.S.-person status or obtaining any necessary license. The applicant will be required to answer certain questions for export control purposes, and that information will be reviewed by compliance personnel to ensure compliance with federal law. ManTech may choose not to apply for a license for such individuals whose access to export-controlled technology or software source code may require authorization and may decline to proceed with an applicant on that basis alone.


ManTech International Corporation, as well as its subsidiaries proactively fulfills its role as an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, national origin, marital status, physical or mental disability, status as a Disabled Veteran, Recently Separated Veteran, Active Duty Wartime or Campaign Badge Veteran, Armed Forces Services Medal, or any other characteristic protected by law.


If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a position with ManTech through its online applicant system, please contact ManTech's Corporate EEO Department at (703) 218-6000. ManTech is an affirmative action/equal opportunity employer - minorities, females, disabled and protected veterans are urged to apply. ManTech's utilization of any external recruitment or job placement agency is predicated upon its full compliance with our equal opportunity/affirmative action policies. ManTech does not accept resumes from unsolicited recruiting firms. We pay no fees for unsolicited services.


If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you have the right to request an accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access http://www.mantech.com/careers/Pages/careers.aspx as a result of your disability. To request an accommodation please click careers@mantech.com and provide your name and contact information.

title: Senior Training Analyst
description:
**Secure our Nation, Ignite your Future**


Become an integral part of a diverse team while working at an Industry Leading Organization, where our employees come first. At ManTech International Corporation, you’ll help protect our national security while working on innovative projects that offer opportunities for advancement.


Currently, we are seeking a motivated, career and team-oriented **Senior Training Analyst** for the data solutions training team in support of the U.S. Department of Homeland Security (DHS) Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) Continuous Diagnostic & Mitigation (CDM) Data Services Program. The CDM Data Services Program is a critical component of CISA’s national effort to ensure the defense and resilience of cyberspace. The ideal candidate will possess a deep understanding of engineering principles, simulation technologies, and training methodologies. As a Senior Training Analyst, you will play a key role in shaping the future of our Dashboard training programs, ensuring they align with industry standards and meet the evolving needs of the CISA workforce. This is a remote position where the candidate can work from any location within the United States provided, they are able to work on an eastern time zone schedule.


The **Dashboard Solution Training Team** is responsible for developing, implementing, and evaluating courses and learning tools that educate and inform end users, agencies and key stakeholders on the successful utilization of the CDM Dashboard. Successful execution of this training program requires strong knowledge of adult learning methodologies, training implementation and facilitation best practices, expert knowledge of common cybersecurity threats, strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate cross-functionally with internal and external partners. This team is expected to work closely with and develop strong working relationships with government and agency specific stakeholders.

**Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:**


Systems Design and Development:

* Lead the design and development of experiential learning courses within a Cyber Range Environment.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and translate them into technical specifications.
* Ensure the integration of the latest technologies to enhance training effectiveness.


Project Leadership:

* Participate in the entire course development life cycle from concept to delivery.
* Provide technical leadership and guidance to the Dashboard Solution training team.
* Collaborate with Lead ISD to establish timelines, identify resources, and monitor project progress.


Technical Expertise:

* Stay current with emerging technologies and trends in simulation, training, and CISA cybersecurity threat alerts and indicators of a compromise.
* Evaluate and recommend new technologies and tools to enhance training capabilities.
* Conduct research and development activities to improve existing systems.


Quality Assurance:

* Participate in a rigorous testing and quality assurance process to ensure the reliability and effectiveness of training courses and resources.
* Collaborate with end-users and stakeholders to gather feedback and continuously improve training performance.


Training Program Facilitation:

* Facilitate synchronous training events and live demos.
* Ensure alignment of learning objectives with dashboard solution architecture.

**Basic Qualifications:**

* A minimum of (8) eight years of experience in a relevant field
* A Minimum of (8) eight years of experience in designing, developing, and delivering training curriculum, simulators, or similar technologies.
* Proven experience facilitating Cybersecurity learning and development curriculum
* Expertise in Cyber Range and other virtualization sandbox technologies.
* Strong systems administration and engineering experience in heterogenous Windows and Linux environments.
* Solid understanding of engineering principles and their application to training and development.
* Deep understanding of CDM Dashboard course development processes
* Familiarity with CISA learning and development platforms, such as, FedVTE
* Familiarity with Open-Source Learning Management Platforms, such as, Moodle
* Familiarity with Federal Systems security hardening standards
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Demonstrated ability to innovate and think creatively to develop state-of-the-art training solutions.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Systems Engineering certifications
* A bachelor’s degree and or a master’s degree in education, computer engineering, IT infrastructure management, or computer science

**Security Clearance Requirements:**

* Must be a U.S. citizen (non-dual citizenship)
* Able to obtain and maintain a DHS Suitability/Entry on Duty (EOD)

**Physical Requirements**

* Must be able to be in a stationary position more than 50% of the time
* Must be able to communicate, converse, and exchange information with peers and senior personnel
* Constantly operates a computer and other office productivity machinery, such as a computer
* The person in this position frequently communicates with co-workers, management, and customers, which may involve delivering presentations. Must be able to exchange accurate information in these situations
* The person in this position needs to occasionally move about inside the office to access file cabinets, office machinery, etc.

The applicant will be required to answer certain questions for export control purposes, and that information will be reviewed by compliance personnel to ensure compliance with federal law. ManTech may choose not to apply for a license for such individuals whose access to export-controlled technology or software source code may require authorization and may decline to proceed with an applicant on that basis alone.

title: SME Cybersecurity Engineering Trainer
description:
**Secure our Nation, Ignite your Future**


Become an integral part of a diverse team while working at an Industry Leading Organization, where our employees come first. At ManTech International Corporation, you’ll help protect our national security while working on innovative projects that offer opportunities for advancement.


Currently, we are seeking a motivated, career and team-oriented **Cybersecurity Engineer****ing SME / Trainer** for the data solutions training team in support of the U.S. Department of Homeland Security (DHS) Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) Continuous Diagnostic & Mitigation (CDM) Data Services Program. The CDM Data Services Program is a critical component of CISA’s national effort to ensure the defense and resilience of cyberspace. This is a remote position where the candidate can work from any location within the United States provided, they are able to work on an eastern time zone schedule.


The CDM Data Services Program mission is to provide a standardized platform to collect, transform, and integrate cybersecurity data from relevant authoritative data sources into a coherent data, delivering actionable information into Agency and Federal Dashboards to identify risk areas in support of mitigation as well as to facilitate coordinated agency and national response to cyber-threats.

**Responsibilities include but are not limited to:**

* Facilitate synchronous training events and live demos.
* Collaborate with instructional designers, engineers, and subject matter experts to create engaging, learner-centric content, such as e-learning modules, manuals, and multimedia, within the Cyber Range Environment. Align with project goals and learning objectives throughout the course development lifecycle, leveraging expertise in Cybersecurity engineering.
* Engage in thorough course development testing and quality assurance to ensure technical soundness and alignment with CISA guidelines, CDM data solution requirements, and cyber range specifications. Utilize Cybersecurity and systems engineering expertise.
* Keep up-to-date on emerging technologies, CISA cybersecurity threats, and industry trends by researching and analyzing COTS cybersecurity training solutions. Provide guidance on integrating these technologies to enhance the learning experience.
* Adapt quickly to new learning tools, technologies, and platforms (e.g., Moodle, emerging cyber range, virtual learning environments).
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and translate requirements into technical specifications.
* Provide technical guidance to the Dashboard Solution training team by identifying data presentation and reporting gaps, including performance, capacity, interoperability, scalability, and manageability. Perform updates, patches, and routine maintenance for the Test Lab and Agency Dashboard instance(s).
* Participate in technical discussions to elicit and communicate resource requirements. Prioritize and conduct advanced troubleshooting, including rapid installation and configuration of test systems.
* Engage with end-users and stakeholders to gather feedback and enhance training performance continuously.

**Basic Qualifications:**

* A minimum of (3 - 5) three - five years of experience in a relevant field
* A minimum of (2) two years of experience in supporting the design, development, and delivery of training curriculum, in various environments such as simulators, or similar technologies.
* Proven experience facilitating Cybersecurity training curriculum
* Solid understanding of engineering principles and their application to training and development.
* Experience with scripting languages like Python, Bash, Powershell, R
* Knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects, etc.), databases (SQL, MySql etc.), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks)
* Proven ability to use multiple REST API authentication types, knowledge of REST methods, and ability to mine APIs to meet data requirements.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Any of the following: Cloud platform certification (AWS, Azure); Security certification (Security+, CASP, CISSP); Tool certifications (Tenable Security Center Specialist, Tanium Certified Administrator, ServiceNow Certified System Administrator)
* A Master’s degree in education, computer engineering, IT infrastructure management, or computer science
* Strong systems administration and engineering experience in heterogenous Windows and Linux environments.
* Familiarity with Open-Source Learning Management Platforms, such as, Moodle
* Expertise in Cyber Range and other virtualization sandbox technologies.

**Clearance Requirements:**

* Must be a US citizen
* Able to obtain and maintain a DHS Suitability (EOD)

**Physical Requirements:**

* Must be able to be in a stationary position more than 50% of the time
* Must be able to communicate, converse, and exchange information with peers and senior personnel
* Constantly operates a computer and other office productivity machinery, such as a computer
* The person in this position frequently communicates with co-workers, management, and customers, which may involve delivering presentations. title: Technical Trainer
description:
**Job Description –** **AHIT Technical Trainer/Instructor**

**Division / Department:?**Instruction & Class Operations

**Reports to (position):** VP Instruction

**Level / Grade:** Individual Contributor

**Supervisory Responsibility:** No, except during training of new employees or trainers

**Location:** Telecommute

**Work Conditions:** Office Environment (Remote)

**Travel:** Potential to have a moderate to extensive travel schedule

**Employment Type:** Full Time, Exempt

**Minimum Educational Req**: Four-year degree, or equivalent home inspection experience

**Years of Experience:** Must have at least 5,000 inspections completed

**Position Summary:**


The CE Shop is the leading provider of online Real Estate. Mortgage, and Home Inspection education. The AHIT Technical Trainer/Instructor will be a member of the Curriculum team and Learner Experience Center of Excellence and will report to the Operations Manager. The position will teach the basic skills necessary to students, so they are able to properly perform residential inspections. The employee is expected to adhere to and ensure team compliance with ethics policies and practices as established by The CE Shop.

 **Job Responsibilities:**

* Lead classroom sessions, virtually or in-person, using company provided materials.
* Connect with and prepare students prior to class for the classroom portion.
* Travel to class locations and provide training in the field to students.
* Supervise inspections, making sure they are conducted to reflect the appropriate Standards of Practice for the state the class is held in.
* Teach client interaction, inspection process, and report writing.
* Review inspection reports for accuracy as required by state law.
* Receive and respond to phone calls, texts, and emails to assist current and former students and active inspectors with their questions.
* Provide continuous feedback and suggestions regarding existing programs and ways to enhance the learning experience, outcomes, and support for students.
* Assist with rollout of new training materials, online content, PowerPoint presentations, outlines, handouts, books, and exams.
* Assist in the creation of marketing materials, articles, webinars, and videos.
* Lead the development of new training courses and materials.
* Assist in the training of field trainers.
* Promote the use and purchase of AHIT’s support services and products.
* Provide The CE Shop with subject matter expertise in home inspection industry knowledge, trends, and state regulations.

**Skills & Experience Required:**

* Industry experience (in home inspection)
* Current Home Inspection License in the state(s) which teaching will be performed.
* Must have completed 5,000 or more home inspections.
* Must have owned (or currently own) a home inspection business.
* Must have passed the NHIE exam or be willing to take and pass the exam.
* AHIT Certification
* Must be knowledgeable and capable of using various Microsoft suite programs (Excel/Word/PowerPoint)

**Physical Requirements:**


The physical demands of this position are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

**Internal and External Interaction:**


This position interacts with students, peers, both in and out of department, and their immediate manager on a regular basis.

**Employment benefits granted upon hire date:**

* 100% discount on Career Certified’s products and services
* Tuition reimbursement, subject to approval
* Paid company holidays (9 days off per year)
* PTO on a take what you need basis, as described in the employee handbook

**Employment benefits granted after 30 days of employment include:**

* Voluntary participation in Career Certified’s medical, dental, and vision plans, as well as supplemental insurance options
* Voluntary participation in Career Certified’s 401k plan

**About The CE Shop:**


The CE Shop, part of the Career Certified family of brands, is the leading provider of professional real estate education with online mortgage, real estate, and home inspection courses available throughout the United States. The CE Shop produces quality education for professionals across the nation, whether they’re veterans in their industry or are looking to launch a new career. We believe that the right education can truly make a difference. Visit TheCEShop.com to learn more.

 **About Career Certified:**


Career Certified elevates modern education while accelerating success for students in licensed professions. From Pre-Licensing, Licensing, and Continuing Education to tools for the entire lifecycle of one’s profession, the company pairs an easy-to-use platform and flexible learning options with a deep understanding of students’ needs to guide them to career freedom. Visit CareerCertified.com to learn more.

title: OpMed IT End User Trainer
description:
**Position Title: OpMed IT End User Trainer**


**Division: AA**


**Location: Remote**


**Position Summary**



Provides EHR training to all end-users including but not limited to the following personnel: functional, technical, administrative, and help desk on the TMIP J suite of applications.


**Essential Duties & Responsibilities**


* Skilled EHR trainer, will perform classroom training, virtual training, computer-based training and over the shoulder training as needed for all end users on the TMIP J suite of applications to include AHLTA- T, TC2, DCAM, TMDS and MSAT/MedCOP; coordinate with on-site readiness professionals for optimization of flexible training schedule for pre-deployment, CMRP requirements and AE needs.
* Performs group and 1:1 TMIP J EHR application training for all AF medical personnel with an identified requirement, live, when possible and will use virtual tools as needed.
* Will maintain records of training activities to include training needs assessments, training attendance records, military training records and student course critiques; will also continuously improve processes and enhance adult learning.
* Exceptional communication, organization, computer skills and ability to perform public speaking.
* Collect, organize, and evaluate clinical/functional, and training metrics; submit reports as required.
* Manage instruction, develop presentations, prepare training aids, and provide over the shoulder support when not conducting formal training; will research and improve teaching capability, emerging technologies and classroom teaching standard of practice as baseline activity.
* Trainers will track training needs of their respective MTF or MAJCOM and communicate with PM for all travel requirements identified, will support site with continuity binder that contains critical information about the MTF/MAJCOM and processes in place identified with POCs.
* Supports all exercises with training support as requested; training support includes, but is not limited to classroom training prior to exercise, over the shoulder support during exercise, and hotwash participation to effectively enhance adult learning and retention of training material.
* Perform “other duties as assigned” by the government deemed necessary for program success.

  


**Education & Experience Requirements**


* Bachelor’s degree in clinical or ancillary or a related field preferred, however, demonstrated equivalent technology training/service-related experience may be substituted if member meets program management/technical requirement needs and proficiency with TMIP J applications.
* The position is best supported by an FTE with a clinical background who then has additional experience training information technology solutions in support of clinical healthcare settings.
* Demonstrated proficiency with all MS Office software, simple program management applications, and experience working with military networks, troubleshooting skills desired, as well as a working knowledge of system administration processes.
* A minimum of five (5) years of demonstrated, successful training and content development experience for healthcare IT systems, with knowledge of healthcare IT training desired.
* Security clearance eligibility required: SECRET.


**Working Conditions/Working Environment/Physical Demands**


* Ability to speak, understand, read and write English fluently to effectively communicate with patients and other health care workers, and shall be respectful of the local, American Indian and Alaska Native culture.

  



Advancia Aeronautics, LLC is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class.

title: Technical Trainer
description:
**Description**


Leidos has an opportunity for a Training Integrator. The successful candidate will work collaboratively with an outstanding engineering and instructional team supporting training and fielding needs for software deployed in the cloud for US Air Force bases across the world. Position requires US citizenship and a current DoD Secret Security Clearance.


This position will be telework, but the ideal candidate will be able to visit one of our sipr sites as needed to access the government classified systems.


Primary Responsibilities

* Gain and maintain tactical and technical proficiency in the Leidos software, requiring self-initiative to propel through the training program. As software is constantly under development, stay abreast of new features and understand the “What’s New” aspects to incorporate into training as required. Once proficient in an area of instruction, mentor other staff members as they upgrade in that area.
* Prepare and deliver operator level training virtually and/or within a classroom environment at Military bases (CONUS and OCONUS), continuing coordination with the base-level POCs to schedule events, convey administrative/logistic requirements.
* Coordinate with military base points of contact (POC) to understand how they will employ the delivered software and how to tailor the training to best meet their needs.
* Maintain existing training library or create new materials when required (e.g., record videos, create/maintain instructor guides, coordinate required edits/peer-reviews, upload materials to milSuite)
* Coordinate with base POCs to perform initial set up (data build) of data required for new software installations. This data includes importing or creating instantiation and organizational data, user accounts and permissions, operational checklists, and base unique features.
* Continue coordination and assistance with base POCs after initial fielding as a Field Service Representative (FSR). FSRs will provide a single point of contact to answer questions, suggest best practices and operational solutions, perform initial troubleshooting, observe base system usage, convey training opportunities, and inform on new/changing features.
* Capture user feedback and relay to the software development team to continually improve the feature set of the tool. Monitor MilSuite for user feedback submitted through the training portal.
* Employ appropriate training sites (via DISA milCloud or other cloud deployments) to illustrate topics or respond to questions posed by users in the field.
* Work closely with developers, other endpoint engineers and training team in an agile environment.
* Lead team in assigned process and projects (e.g., New Features training, server maintenance, train-the-trainer or Scrum process).
* Gain and maintain tactical and technical proficiency in the Leidos software to participate in the NIPR and SIPR Help Desk schedule. Support deployed software system with Help Desk activities, reviewing Help Desk tickets submitted by the field, perform initial troubleshooting and providing operational translation of described issues as required. Travel to sites maybe required.
* Train developers in the front-end/operator use of the software, enabling them to better respond to Help Desk tickets from the field.
* Work independently and under minimal supervision.


Basic Qualifications

* Bachelor's degree with 6 years of applicable experience or 6 additional years of experience in lieu of degree; and minimum 4 years of training experience in a military environment
* Strong understanding of Military operations; including Emergency Management (EM); Crisis Action Team (CAT) or Emergency Operations Center (EOC) operations; Command and Control (C2); Agile Combat Employment (ACE); or Continuity of Operations Planning (COOP)
* Experience in training end users in USAF software application installation and daily operations
* Experience in drafting and maintaining training course materials (programs, syllabi, users guides, and videos)
* Experience testing, evaluating, and supporting the integration of new technology or applications
* Must have excellent attention to detail and organization/problem-solving skills
* Must have an active DoD Secret Security Clearance
* U.S. Citizenship required


Preferred Qualifications

* Experience with the Leidos software application C2IMERA, its predecessors or similar
* Experience managing projects within the Atlassian suite of tools (Confluence, JIRA, Bitbucket).
* Familiarity with the agile software development process.
* Proximity to Langley AFB or other sites currently providing C2IMERA access to SIPR
* Understanding of Joint All-Domain Command and Control (JADC2) and/or Advanced Battle Management System (ABMS)
* Certification or experience with ArcGIS geospatial software

**Original Posting Date:**
--------------------------


2024-03-04
While subject to change based on business needs, Leidos reasonably anticipates that this job requisition will remain open for at least 3 days with an anticipated close date of no earlier than 3 days after the original posting date as listed above.

**Pay Range:**
--------------


Pay Range $61,750.00 - $111,625.00
The Leidos pay range for this job level is a general guideline only and not a guarantee of compensation or salary. Additional factors considered in extending an offer include (but are not limited to) responsibilities of the job, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity, alignment with market data, applicable bargaining agreement (if any), or other law.

title: Policy, Procedure & Training Analyst (Remote)
description:
**ABOUT THE ORGANIZATION**  

  

SMBC MANUBANK was formed by a group of banking entrepreneurs in June 1962. Our scope is to serve the specialized needs of California middle-market businesses, manufacturers, wholesalers, distributors, importers, exporters, and service companies, including small businesses and professionals.


The anticipated salary range for this role is between $69,000.00 and $81,000.00. The specific salary offered to an applicant will be based on their individual qualifications, experiences, and an analysis of the current compensation paid in their geography and the market for similar roles at the time of hire. The role may also be eligible for an annual discretionary incentive award. In addition to cash compensation, SMBC offers a competitive portfolio of benefits to its employees.


Our mission is to be "the bank of choice" for middle market and professional service companies by establishing long term customer relationships and loyalty, providing superior products and services through a core of highly skilled and seasoned bankers.  

To achieve our mission to be the 'bank of choice' for middle market and professional services companies, we are focused on our vision to be the premier California regional business bank that can provide the sophistication and expertise of a larger institution with the personal 'high touch' services of a smaller bank.

  

Specialties:


Commercial Loans and Lines of Credit, Asset-Based Financing, SBA Loans, and Specialized Financing, Real Estate Loans, Cash Management Services, International Services

**Job Summary:**
----------------


Under minimal supervision assist the Bank’s Head of Compliance Program Governance and Reporting or delegated manager with the oversight of the Compliance Policy, Procedure and Training functions. Additionally, the compliance analyst researches and maintains current knowledge of compliance laws and regulations. The compliance analyst must have a strong background in banking operations and be knowledgeable of bank products and services to assess the impact that changes in laws or regulations have on the Bank.


**Principal Duties and Responsibilities:**
------------------------------------------

* Manages the creation, maintenance, and governance of the Compliance policies and procedures.
* Manages the administration of the Compliance Training program through the bank’s Learning Management system.
* Assist in the creation of reports in all Microsoft products.
* Assists in the oversight of the compliance program to ensure that compliance risks are appropriately identified, monitored, and controlled.
* Performs special projects and other duties as assigned.
* The individual hired to fill this position will be primarily responsible for the training program, compliance policy and procedures; however, may be called upon to assist with other activities of the compliance department, as time permits.
**Job Specifications:**
-----------------------

**Education:** Bachelor’s Degree, or equivalent experience in banking and compliance functions. CRCM or similar certification is preferred.  

  

**Experience:** 5+ years of experience with regulatory compliance in a banking environment. 5+ years in the banking industry.

**Skills/Qualifications:**

* Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint is required.
* Must possess excellent oral and written communication skills and experience communicating with all levels of management.
* Must be a team player and ready to work as a cohesive group.
* Must be adaptable and able to work in a changing environment.
* Must be detail oriented, thorough, and well organized.
* Must be self-motivated, able to take direction and be responsible for the end work product.
* Must be practical, logical, and a critical thinker with an ability to solve problems.
* Must be efficient and possess time management skills.
* Must be able to work independently or as a team.
* Must be able to learn quickly and apply knowledge and experience to the changing environment.
* Must be proactive
* Individuals that exhibit a high level of emotional intelligence, leadership qualities, ability to work under pressure, and have a strong work ethic are preferred.
**EOE STATEMENT**  

We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

**CCPA DISCLOSURE**  

Personal Information Collection Notice: This notice contains information under the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) about the categories of personal information (PI) of California residents that SMBC MANUBANK collects and the business or commercial purpose(s) for which the PI may be used. We do not sell PI. More information about our collection and use of PI may be found in our CCPA Privacy Policy at https://www.manufacturersbank.com/CCPA-Privacy. Persons with disabilities may contact our Customer Contact Center toll-free at (877) 560-9812 to request the information in this Notice in an alternative format.

title: Trainer & Customer Support Rep - Tier 1
description:
Total Dealer Solutions is seeking a dedicated and solution-oriented Software Trainer & Customer Support Representative.

\\*\\*This position is training and support for custom software. Throughout onboarding, learning progression and core values adherence will be evaluated at 30/60/90 day intervals following the Entrepreneurial Operating System (EOS).\\*\\*

The person in this role is primarily responsible for training new and existing clients how to use our automotive parts inventory to GL reconciliation software, PartsRec.

* Must have excellent communication skills, time management and organizational skills, work ethic, attention to detail, ability to adapt and learn quickly, technical skills, and a strong desire to help people.
* Previous software or tech support experience required. Automotive parts experience and/or accounting experience is a plus.

**Job Responsibilities:**

* Client Trainings - train clients how to use PartsRec software
* Help Tickets - solve help tickets via multiple communication channels
* Client Onboardings - complete new client installs

**Job Requirements:**

* Experience in software/technical customer support
* Experience working remotely
* Experience in automotive parts inventory, parts to GL reconciliation, and/or accounting
* Ability to utilize GoToMeeting to conduct client training sessions
* Ability to utilize Zendesk ticket system to document and manage customer support requests
* Technical skill set including a demonstrated understanding of software technologies and web functionality
* Active listener who seeks to understand root cause of issues
* Excellent communication, in verbal and written formats
* Motivated quick study with a problem-solving attitude
* Self-disciplined and organized
* Persistent work ethic with a positive and respectful team player mentality
* Desire to grow and pitch in where needed

**Who we are:**

Founded in 2003, Total Dealer Solutions provides software and service offerings to Automotive Dealers to help manage, count, and reconcile their parts inventory. Our core focus is integrating people, process, and technology to solve common dealer parts problems.

At Total Dealer Solutions we hold the bar high in everything we do. We take personal accountability, always show up, and meet our commitments through hard work and dedication. We never say, “that’s not my job” and strive for innovation and to be a part of the solution not the problem. We embrace challenges and know mistakes are ok if we learn from them and believe nothing is impossible. We don’t coast and pitch in where needed to maximize efficiency and drive results. We treat others the way we want to be treated, encourage debate, seek feedback, and believe open and honest communication is the best path to our success.

We are working to build a team that is representative of these core values. If this sounds like you, come join us!

**Additional Details:**

* Full Time: Monday through Friday 8am – 5pm Mountain time zone (10am-7pm ET, 9am-6pm CT)
* Opportunity for growth and advancement (Tier 1 salary range $40-$50K, Tier 2 salary range $55-$70K, we typically promote from within)
* 15 days paid vacation
* This is a remote position, must have access to a computer, reliable internet connection, available Hotspot and a private/quiet space or home office.
* We use Slack, GoToMeeting, Zendesk, Jive, Azure DevOps, Trello, SQL management studio, Calendly, and Microsoft Office – experience with these technologies is a plus.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $40,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* What is PartsRec?

Experience:

* Automotive Parts: 1 year (Preferred)
* Software Training: 1 year (Required)
* Help Desk: 1 year (Required)
* Training & development: 1 year (Required)
* Accounting: 1 year (Preferred)
* Inventory management: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Customer Support Technical Trainer
description:
Planet DDS is the leading provider of cloud-enabled dental software solutions serving over 10,000 practices in North America with over 60,000 users. The company delivers a complete platform of solutions for dental practices including Denticon Practice Management, Apteryx XVWeb Digital Imaging, Cloud 9 Practice Management (for Orthodontist practices) and Legwork Patient Relationship Management. Planet DDS is committed to creating value for its dental practice clients by solving the most urgent challenges facing today’s dental practices in North America.  

  

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Customer Support Technical Trainer to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, developing, and delivering comprehensive technical training programs for our customer support staff. This role requires a deep understanding of our products and services, as well as excellent communication and instructional abilities to ensure that our support team is equipped with the knowledge and skills necessary to provide exceptional service to our customers.  

  

This is a remote position within the United States.  

  

**Job Duties*** Develop training materials, including presentations, guides, manuals, and multimedia visual aids, to effectively convey technical concepts and procedures.
* Collaborate with subject matter experts to ensure accuracy and relevance of training content.
* Conduct training sessions for new hires, as well as ongoing training for existing support staff, both in-person and remotely.
* Utilize various training methodologies and techniques, such as classroom instruction, workshops, online tutorials, and simulations, to cater to different learning styles and preferences.
* Assess training needs and performance gaps among support team members and tailor training programs accordingly.
* Evaluate the effectiveness of training programs through assessments, feedback, and performance metrics, and continuously improve training materials and methodologies based on results.
* Stay updated on industry trends, product updates, and best practices to ensure that training content remains current and relevant.
* Provide technical assistance and support to customer support staff as needed, serving as a resource for complex technical issues.
* Collaborate with other departments, such as product development and customer success, to ensure alignment of training initiatives with organizational goals and objectives.
* Maintain documentation of training activities, including attendance records, training schedules, and training evaluation reports.

  

**Skills and Qualifications:*** Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Computer Science, Information Technology, Education) or equivalent work experience.
* 5-7 years of proven experience in technical training, preferably in a customer support or software/technology environment.
* Strong understanding of technical concepts, software applications, and troubleshooting methodologies.
* Excellent presentation and communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex ideas in a clear and concise manner.
* Demonstrated ability to develop engaging and effective training materials using various tools and technologies.
* Experience with learning management systems (LMS) and other training delivery platforms.
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
* Strong organizational skills with attention to detail and the ability to manage multiple priorities.
* Previous experience in customer support or technical support roles.
* Certification in training and development (e.g., Certified Professional in Learning and Performance - CPLP).
* Familiarity with instructional design principles and adult learning theories.
* Experience with video editing and multimedia production tools.
* Knowledge of customer relationship management (CRM) systems and help desk software.

**PLANET DDS CORE IDEOLOGY**

**Why are we here?**


Unleashing dentists and their staff to focus on patient care.


**Where are we headed?**

In the next 5 years, Planet DDS will remain the leading provider of clous-based technology solutions in North America, expanding to serve more than 25,000 dental practices.


**How do we get there?**


To encourage measurable progress toward our vision and make the best decisions on behalf of employees and customers, we adopted a set of common values:


Collaborative – Working independently and across teams, we create scalable solutions to enable company growth


Empathetic – We are educated on the experience of our customers and feel vested in their success


Accountable – We feel ownership for the quality of our work and take pride in the positive outcomes


Trustworthy – We operate with integrity and honest, making promises we know that we can keep


Ambitious – We are driven by our ability to make a long-term, positive impact on the lives of dental market leaders

title: Implementation Analyst
description:
We are looking to hire a talented **Implementations Analyst!**


The Implementations Analyst responsible for the consultation, project management, installation and setup of software solutions that best meet the client’s business needs. Responsible for client training and technical support throughout the implementation.


**What you will do:**


**Project Management**


Works with project manager and directly with clients to successfully implement software from beginning to end. Prepares implementation documentation outlining the scope of work, project plan, and surveys. Consults with clients to understand their business processes and procedures and implement best practices. Manages list of open deliverables and issues that are critical to obtaining client signoff to go live separately from minor issues and enhancement requests.


**Customer Satisfaction**


Ensures the highest levels of customer satisfaction from project inception to client testing and acceptance. Sets and manages expectations and drives to meet deadlines. Ensures that the highest levels of service are provided by all parties involved and escalates when appropriate.


**Training and Support**


Responsible for training and support during the implementation period. Assists clients with training for key employees at the credit union and provides support via telephone and email throughout the implementation process.


**The Ideal Candidate:**


**Education****:**


BA/BS degree or two years commensurate experience.


**Experience****:**


* Two years experience providing implementation assistance for a large scale system software
* Strong knowledge of credit union operations and regulatory, compliance, credit scoring and lending environments
* Experience with loan originations systems and credit union core data processing systems is preferred


**Specialized Skills****:**


* Strong project management skills with a demonstrated ability to manage on-time software projects
* Ability to manage several on-going projects at various stages in the process
* Strong oral and written communication skills
* Ability to influence others without direct authority; skillful negotiator with strong conflict management skills
* Excellent knowledge of PC based computer systems, including MS Word, Project, PowerPoint, Excel, etc.
* Strong technical aptitude with the ability to rapidly learn new systems and provide training and support to others
* Ability to travel


**Perks and Benefits:**


* Flexible Working Environment
* Paid Time Off
* 401k (8% match)
* College Tuition Benefits/ Tuition Reimbursement
* Good Benefits options
* Company Culture! Cultural and Holiday celebrations, Theme days like Star Wars Day & Bring your Kids to Work Day, Monthly Townhalls and Quarterly Company Meetings that ensure awareness, inclusion, and transparency.


The starting salary range for this full-time position is $62100- $77600 per year. This base pay will take into consideration internal equity, candidate’s geographic region, job-related knowledge and experience among other factors. Origence maintains a highly competitive compensation program. Under company guidelines, this position is eligible for an annual bonus to provide an incentive to achieve targeted goals. Bonuses are awarded at company’s discretion on an individual basis.


Origence is an equal opportunity employer. All recruitment, hiring, training, compensation, benefits, discipline, and other terms and conditions of employment will be based upon an individuals’ qualifications regardless of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, military service, marital status, pregnancy, age, protected medical condition, genetic information, disability or any other category protected by federal, state or local law.

title: Software Trainer
description:
Join our team during a period of exponential growth as a Software Trainer responsible for delivering training services to Automotive Dealers nationwide. In this role, you will provide industry-leading training to external clients, empowering them with a thorough understanding of our A2Z software functionality.A2Z Sync is a centralized platform designed to reduce costs for clients, eliminate the need for disparate tools to facilitate a vehicle transaction, and provide cutting-edge technology advancements. This allows dealers to gain market share by delivering an unparalleled customer experience.

 **Overview**

  

The Software Trainer plays a critical role within the launch team, responsible for delivering training services to external clients and internal stakeholders. A2Z offers a variety of training methods, including video conferencing, on-site training, webinars, and learning management system content, to ensure convenience and effectiveness for our clients. **This position requires up to 50% travel.**

 **Responsibilities**

* Deliver remote and onsite training services to new and existing clients.
* Provide training to internal stakeholders, sales team members and other customer facing dealership employees.
* Continuously develop instructional delivery and presentation skills
* Assess client progress and readiness for independent operation.
* Coordinate and complete administrative functions necessary for training programs
* Provide timely updates to sales, implementation, and client support teams.
* Uphold A2Z’s core values and exceed client expectations.
* Demonstrate proficient understanding of A2Z’s software solutions and educate clients accordingly.
* Work effectively in a fast-paced, team-based, customer service-oriented environment
* Communicate professionally and effectively, focusing on adult learning methodologies.
* Exercise good judgment, discretion, and tact while working with clients.
* Influence clients to adopt A2Z’s approaches to fulfill functional requirements.
* Maintain a courteous, professional, and confident demeanor throughout the training process.

  


**Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree in a related field or equivalent work experience
* **Prior experience working at an automotive software vendor company.**
* Prior experience in software training or related fields
* Strong communication and presentation skills
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Proficient understanding of software capabilities and best practice
* *Must be coachable, curious by nature, and adaptable to change management needs.*

  


**About A2Z Sync**



A2Z Sync is a fast-paced and innovative automotive SaaS company seeking to make life better for our customers. We offer you a fun, casual, and collaborative culture, while fostering an environment where you work hard, see your results, and feel your impact. We are committed to our employees, and this starts with providing benefits that allow you to care for you and your family.

 **Here’s how we are doing it:**

* We cover your STD/LTD and life Insurance
* Matching 401k plan
* Unlimited paid time off, including 9 paid holidays
* Generous employee referral program
* Career growth and development
* Opportunity to work with a great team where your insights and expertise will be valued

  


**Mission**



To make the complex journey of automotive retail simpler and more profitable.

 **Values**


* Customer Focus: we are passionate about our customers' success
* Integrity: we are transparent and honest, and communicate openly
* Innovation: we thrive on proving the unproven
* Accountability: we do what we say, and we follow through
* Inclusivity: we value and honor diversity of opinions, experiences, and backgrounds
* Community: we support our team and serve our local community

  


**Here’s how we are doing it:**


* A2Z Sync offers comprehensive medical, dental, and vision benefits.

title: Technology Training & Enablement Lead
description:
**Company Description**  

At ServiceNow, our technology makes the world work for everyone, and our people make it possible. We move fast because the world can’t wait, and we innovate in ways no one else can for our customers and communities. By joining ServiceNow, you are part of an ambitious team of change makers who have a restless curiosity and a drive for ingenuity. We know that your best work happens when you live your best life and share your unique talents, so we do everything we can to make that possible. We dream big together, supporting each other to make our individual and collective dreams come true. The future is ours, and it starts with you.


With more than 7,700+ customers, we serve approximately 85% of the Fortune 500®, and we're proud to be one of FORTUNE 100 Best Companies to Work For® and World's Most Admired Companies™.


Learn more on Life at Now blog and hear from our employees about their experiences working at ServiceNow.


Unsure if you meet all the qualifications of a job description but are deeply excited about the role? We still encourage you to apply! At ServiceNow, we are committed to creating an inclusive environment where all voices are heard, valued, and respected. We welcome all candidates, including individuals from non-traditional, varied backgrounds, that might not come from a typical path connected to this role. We believe skills and experience are transferrable, and the desire to dream big makes for great candidates.

 **Job Description** **About Digital Technology**


We’re not yesterday’s IT department, we're Digital Technology. The world around us keeps changing and so do we. We’re redefining what it means to be IT with a mindset centered on transformation, experience, AI-driven automation, innovation, and growth. We’re all about delivering delightful, secure customer and employee experiences that accelerate ServiceNow’s journey to become the defining enterprise software company of the 21st century. And we love co-creating, using, and highlighting our own products to do it.


Ultimately, we strive to make the world work better for our employees and customers—when you work in ServiceNow Digital Technology, you work for them.

**Role:**


Come join the Office of the CDIO team and be a part of the Digital Technology (DT) transformation. In this role, you’ll own the development and execution of the Learning and Development strategy for the DT organization.


Your first job will be to partner closely with the DT leadership team to define the learning and enablement roadmap for DT. To build a successful roadmap, you will need to bring your thought leadership, partner with key stakeholders to identify business requirements, understand existing challenges and capabilities, and scope out a detailed approach for implementation. Once the roadmap is in place, you will lead L&D program execution, partnering with internal SMEs, our DT Leadership Team, Talent Development, vendors, and contractors to create the right learning strategy for Digital Technology.

**What you get to do in this role:**

**Create:**

* Create the global strategy and foundation for Learning and Development across Digital Technology.
* Build a deep understanding of DT - strategies, goals, challenges, and capability gaps and provide solutions to address the needs across early in career, mid-career, and leadership levels.
* Develop strategic partnerships with leaders to create, deliver, and evolve a training strategy and accompanying roadmap that enables our managers and individual contributors across all DT roles – including software engineers, program managers, and product management teams - to continue to fuel our growth.
* Implement DT-wide programming for 1,800+ global employees, working closely with other members of the Office of the CDIO, Leadership in DT, DT People Team, ServiceNow Talent Acquisition and Development team, and SMEs across the organization.

**Collaborate:**

* Work proactively and collaboratively with stakeholder leadership to assess and identify needed learning interventions and success factors.
* Provide thought leadership by staying abreast of new L&D trends to meet stakeholder needs and identify new offerings and methods.
* Build a small team and source and identify the right vendors to design, develop, deliver, and maintain high-quality learning that enables employees to execute on pace with the business.

**Deliver & Measure:**

* Build specific training programs to support the overall vision and roadmap (i.e. onboarding, technical learning, engagement, performance, early in career, and skill development for targeted functions).
* Analyze data and develop insights to ensure the effectiveness of Learning and Development programs to the business, and inform continual process, efficiency, and effectiveness.
* Manage all communications with your stakeholders to ensure successful adoption

  

**Qualifications**  

In order to be successful in this role, you will be someone who:

  

* Has 10+ Years technical learning and development management and leadership experience, preferably for Engineering, Support or Services organizations within a fast-growing enterprise SaaS company.
* Is passionate about creating a learning strategy and roadmap for teams that deliver demonstrable value to the business.
* Has built managed and balanced a learning portfolio for multiple stakeholders and collaborated across business units to optimize resources.
* Is an innovator and is not afraid to throw out the playbook to try something new or build/rebuild something from scratch.
* Is an agile and proactive partner- able to operate agilely in a high-growth tech environment where structures and processes are still being built or defined.
* Enjoys partnering with a team of learning program managers, curriculum designers and developers, instructors, and learning platform administrators to develop, deliver, and optimize technical training.
* Has proven expertise in modern course development and delivery methods and tools.
* Is experienced in designing and facilitating a variety of learning offerings: web-based/eLearning, video, instructor-led classes, blended learning, and assessments.
* Consistently operates with integrity, diplomacy, low boundaries and a high desire to work with partners to deliver the right capability-building offerings for an enterprise.
* Is experienced in presenting to, partnering with, and guiding engineering and senior business management. Outstanding executive-level verbal and written communication skills.
* Has strong attention to detail, accuracy, and analytical skills with a strong desire for continuous improvement.


#DTjobs

  

JV20

 **Additional Information**  

ServiceNow is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status or any other category protected by law.


At ServiceNow, we lead with flexibility and trust in our distributed world of work. Click here to learn about our work personas: flexible, remote and required-in-office.


If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact us at talent.acquisition@servicenow.com for assistance.


For positions requiring access to technical data subject to export control regulations, including Export Administration Regulations (EAR), ServiceNow may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Government for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by the U.S. Government.


Please Note: Fraudulent job postings/job scams are increasingly common. Click here to learn what to watch out for and how to protect yourself. All genuine ServiceNow job postings can be found through the ServiceNow Careers site.
